title: (x) Pop art hyperrealism U.S.A. - Cuckoo {Lisa P}
content:
can anyone identify this headline typeface? this is taken from a museum poster of a small art institution in austria.   
 ![hyperrealism](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10871.jpg)

 [‹ Archive through June 05, 2003](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546/http:/www.typophile.com/node/368 "Go to previous forum topic") [Numerals on Penn central locomotives ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546/http:/www.typophile.com/node/280 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Blue Global us in the same vein.   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/blue-global/regular/?s=POP+ART+HYPERREALISM+U.S.A](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/blue-global/regular/?s=POP%2BART%2BHYPERREALISM%2BU.S.A)
thanks. very close! - looks like someone took the actual font and made a sort of comical version of it. unfortunately... so, the hunt continues.

I think actually spotted the typeface you're looking for. I only saw it for a second but it was used for the logo/title of TLC's tv show, 'For Better or for Worse.'   
   
 [http://tlc.discovery.com/tuneins/forbetterorworse](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546/http:/tlc.discovery.com/tuneins/forbetterorworse).   
(Sorry, no picures of it are on the web yet--I guess the show isn't very popular.)
thanks for info, but since i cannot see anything online, the hunt is still on......

I think Larabie has a font similar, don't know the name   
+ there's Eggwhite at FontBureau...by Cyrus Highsmith.   
   
 [www.fontbureau.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546/http:/www.fontbureau.com/)   
   
don't hurt em Hammyr...
thanks... well, larabie ALWAYS has a font similar.... and EGGWHITE again is a somewhat more comical version of what i am looking for... so, the hunt continues...
I believe it is cuckoo. I found a download site [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546/http:/www.geocities.com/Paris/Rue/3080/emlynnfont.html)

excellent, that's the one! and thanks very much lisa p. - cheers!   
   
 ![cuckoo sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906165546im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11393.jpg)
Nice, Lisa. You really had to dredge the gutter for that one.
